723296f-a.title: Manhattan: South Street - Peck Slip
723296f-a.text:
South Street, west side, south from Peck Slip, showing in the foreground Meyers Hotel (Nos. 116-117 South Street), at the S.W. corner of said streets. Buildings on the right are Nos. 40 to 36 Peck Slip, adjoining and
west of the S.W. corner of South Street.
January 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
723296f-a.folder: South Street & Peck Slip, Manhattan, NY

723288f-a.title: Manhattan: South Street - Peck Slip
723288f-a.text:
113 to 104 South Street, west side, south from, but not including Peck Slip, to Beekman Street. This sector is part of the Fulton Fish Market area; reputed to be the largest of its kind in the world. Also shown silhouetted against the sky (left to right), are the Farmer's Loan and Trust Co., and the Bank of Manhattan Co. buildings.
March 27, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
723288f-a.folder: South Street & Peck Slip, Manhattan, NY

723292f-a.title: Manhattan: South Street - Peck Slip
723292f-a.text:
152 to 160 South Street, west side, from Peck Slip (left) to Dover Street (right) as seen thru the lattice work of the Brooklyn Bridge. The 4 story corner building at Peck Slip bears No. 45. Also shown is a general view of lower Manhattan with the Woolworth Building on the right.
June 5, 1932.
P. L. .Sperr.
P9i 1P3; A (3 21
723292f-a.folder: South Street & Peck Slip, Manhattan, NY

723295f-a.title: Manhattan: South Street - Peck Slip
723295f-a.text:
South Street (right), west side, north from Peck Slip. Also shown is Peck Slip (left), north side, west of South, to Front Streets. Note the Brooklyn Bridge projecting eastward across the roofs of buildings on South
Street.
Sanuary 31, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
Si0 Neog . A- 13 ET
723295f-a.folder: South Street & Peck Slip, Manhattan, NY

722524f-b.title: Manhattan: Peck Slip - South Street
722524f-b.text:
(1)
Peck Slip, at, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of South Street. Also shown is South Street, at, adjoining and north of the N.W. corner of
Peck Slip.
August 21, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
fF Neo A - i3SG
(2)
A slightly more extensive view on Peck Slip to Front Street. These buildings are, from right to left Nos. 45 to 35. Shown on South Street
(right) are Nos. 152 and 153 of that street.
January 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
Po 0.4 WG NCg
722524f-b.folder: Peck Slip & South Street, Manhattan, NY

722524f-a.text:
(1)

723293f-a.title: Manhattan: South Street - Peck Slip
723293f-a.text:
South Street, east side, at the foot of Peck Slip, showing pier fronts and loading apparatus on the East River front. In the foreground is Pier No. 20. Dominating the background is the Brooklyn Bridge .
September 3, 1940
P. L. Sperr
723293f-a.folder: South Street & Peck Slip, Manhattan, NY

722525f-b.title: Manhattan: Peck Slip - South Street
722525f-b.text:
Peck Slip, north side, west from South Street, showing an inclusive view of one side of this short thoroughfare which at one time consisted of 1 block and became extended to the present 3 by marginal fills of the East River; Water and Front and now South Streets being respectively at the river's edge. Here stand some of the oldest buildings in Manhattan, prominent of which are the 2 low white faced structures to the left. Individual views and pertinent data will be found on other mounts. Note the Municipal Building and the old U.S.P.0. done in the background. Preceding the latter is the Meyer Hotel at the S.W. corner of South Street which still continues its
original functions, but to a different clientele.
September 1914.
George L. Balgue.
Two additional views of the same locality. The photographer
gives the following data:No. 1 Peck Slip is 4 story brick at
corner of Pearl Street. (314 Pearl St.)
17-19 Peck Slip is 5 story brick at
corner of Water Street (barber
shop painted white, on corner).
29-31 Peck Slip is 5 story brick.
29 Bell Fish Co.
3i Endicott Fish Co.
View No. 3 shows the three buildings (No's. 35-37-39) at, and adjoining the N. E. corner of Front Street. These appear at the
left in View No. 1.
1939
Beecher Ogden
No Reproductions
722525f-b.folder: Peck Slip & South Street, Manhattan, NY

722525f-a.title: Manhattan: Peck Slip - South Street
722525f-a.text:

722526f-a.title: Manhattan: Peck Slip - South Street
722526f-a.text:
Peck Slip, south side, west from but not including South, to and including Pearl Streets. (Peck Slip is arbitrarily set to run East and
West.)
March 27, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
722526f-a.folder: Peck Slip & South Street, Manhattan, NY

1508177-a.title: South Street - Peck Slip
1508177-a.folder: South Street - Peck Slip, Manhattan, NY

723294f.title: Manhattan: South Street - Peck Slip
723294f.text:
South Street, west side, soth from Peck Slip, showing the overflow from the Fulton Fish Market on the river side
of this marginal thoroughfare.
Views 2 and 3 are limited to the S.W. corner of Peck 2lip, showing Meyer's Eotel at that location.
Views: 1-2 1936
W.P. A. Photo
Federal Writers Project
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS  View 3: April 3, 1934
